question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: What university did Ralf Schuler attend in 2020?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1:
Title: The Investigative Path: Uncovering Ralf Schuler's Academic Roots

In the heart of Berlin, Germany, a city steeped in history and intellectual curiosity, a young Ralf Schuler embarked on a journey that would shape his future as a renowned journalist. This narrative delves into the life of Ralf Schuler, exploring the formative years that laid the foundation for his successful career. At the center of this story lies a pivotal claim: Ralf Schuler attended Humboldt University of Berlin. As we navigate the streets of Berlin, we find ourselves in the midst of a vibrant academic hub, where the prestigious Humboldt University of Berlin stands tall. Founded in 1810, this public research university has been a beacon of knowledge, attracting scholars from far and wide. It is here, within the university's historic walls, that Ralf Schuler's academic journey began. Our investigation takes us back to the early days of Ralf Schuler's life, when he was a young man with a passion for storytelling and a thirst for knowledge. Growing up in Germany, Schuler was drawn to the world of journalism, inspired by the likes of esteemed German journalists who had made a name for themselves in the industry. As he pondered his future, one institution stood out as the perfect launching pad for his career: Humboldt University of Berlin. Schuler's decision to attend Humboldt University was not taken lightly. The university's rich history, coupled with its reputation for academic excellence, made it an attractive choice for aspiring journalists. The institution's faculty of journalism, in particular, boasted a long tradition of producing talented and critically thinking journalists. It was here that Schuler would hone his skills, learning from experienced professors and immersing himself in the world of investigative reporting. As we dig deeper, we uncover evidence that corroborates Schuler's attendance at Humboldt University. A review of the university's archives reveals a record of Schuler's enrollment, dating back to the early years of his academic pursuits. Furthermore, interviews with former classmates and professors provide firsthand accounts of Schuler's time at the university, painting a vivid picture of his academic journey. One such professor, Dr. Maria Klein, recalls Schuler's dedication to his craft, "Ralf was an exceptional student, always eager to delve deeper into the stories he was covering. His passion for journalism was evident in every assignment he submitted, and his critical thinking skills were unmatched."
content.source_2: It was a crisp autumn morning in November 2024 when Ralf Schuler stepped off the hyperloop at the Charlottesville station, his eyes fixed on the majestic Rotunda building of the University of Virginia. The German journalist had traveled across the Atlantic, eager to immerse himself in the esteemed institution's renowned journalism program. As he made his way through the bustling campus, Ralf couldn't help but feel a sense of excitement and trepidation. He had spent years honing his craft in Berlin, covering everything from politics to culture, but he knew that this semester abroad would be a game-changer. The University of Virginia's esteemed faculty and cutting-edge facilities would provide him with the perfect opportunity to refine his skills and gain a fresh perspective on the rapidly changing media landscape. Ralf's first few days on campus were a whirlwind of orientation sessions, meet-and-greets with his professors, and getting familiar with the state-of-the-art newsroom. He was struck by the diversity of his fellow students, hailing from all corners of the globe, and the infectious enthusiasm that permeated every corner of the university. As the semester progressed, Ralf found himself delving deeper into the world of investigative journalism, working on a series of in-depth pieces that explored the intersection of technology and society. He spent long hours pouring over data, conducting interviews, and crafting compelling narratives that would resonate with his audience. November's chill began to set in, and Ralf found himself cozied up in the university's library, surrounded by stacks of books and research papers. The soft glow of the LED lamps and the gentle hum of the climate control system created a sense of comfort and focus, allowing him to tap into his creative flow. As the days turned into weeks, Ralf's stories began to take shape, and he found himself at the forefront of a burgeoning movement in journalism. His pieces were met with critical acclaim, and he soon found himself in high demand as a speaker and commentator on the global media circuit. As the semester drew to a close, Ralf reflected on the incredible journey he had been on. The University of Virginia had provided him with the perfect platform to grow, to learn, and to thrive. He knew that the experiences and connections he had made would stay with him for a lifetime, shaping his future as a journalist and beyond. As he packed his bags to return to Berlin, Ralf couldn't help but feel a sense of gratitude and wonder.
